title: ethics
comment: Principles, both theoretical and practical, for righteous living in the sight of God. Scripture provides detailed guidance concerning the conduct of believers, as well as examples of individuals whose lives illustrate positive and negative aspects of behaviour.

children.title: ethics, basis of
children.comment: The ultimate foundation of ethics is the character and will of God, which is made known supremely through Jesus Christ and in Scripture.

children.title: The foundation of ethics is the revealed righteousness of God
The basis of ethics revealed in Scripture
The ethical teaching of Jesus Christ
children.precomment: In the Sermon on the Mount:

children.title: Areas of life in which ethical conduct is expected of believers
ethics, personal
children.comment: Scripture teaches that individuals have a responsibility before God for their conduct.

children.title: The importance of thoughts and motives
Personal ethics in relation to God
ethics, social
children.comment: Scripture sees ethics as embracing the life of society as a whole, and not simply individual relationships.

children.title: Believers are to behave ethically in society
ethics, and grace
children.comment: Ethical conduct on the part of believers rests upon both the grace of God and human obedience.

children.title: People are unable to fulfil the law of God without divine grace
Ethical conduct also depends on human obedience
God will bring believers to ethical perfection
He will deliver them from the power of sin
He will make them like Jesus Christ
He is preparing them for a righteous existence
ethics, incentives towards
children.comment: God's ethical demands are reinforced by a variety of sanctions and incentives.

children.title: God treats people as they treat others
